chapter.title: Customizing the message format
chapter.para: The format of the messages received from the eventlog and the file sources can be customized using templates. You can define separate message format for the eventlog and the file sources. If you have multiple destination servers configured, you can define separate templates for each server. When creating a template to customize the message format, you can use macros, all alphanumeric characters, and the following special characters: <>,():;-+/_.
By default, &agentabbrev; uses the following templates to forward messages:

listitem.para: For messages read from the eventlog, the $MESSAGE part is ${EVENT_USERNAME}: ${EVENT_NAME} ${EVENT_SOURCE}: [${EVENT_TYPE}] ${EVENT_MSG} (EventID ${EVENT_ID}) for every protocol.
For messages read from a file, the $MESSAGE part is $FILE_NAME: $FILE_CURRENT_POSITION/$FILE_SIZE: $FILE_MESSAGE for every protocol.

section.title: Customizing the timestamp used by the &agentabbrev;
section.para: The &agentabbrev; can send the syslog messages using either the ISO or the BSD timestamp format. It is recommended to use the ISO format, because it contains much more information than the BSD format.

Note that in the &agentabbrev;, the macros without prefix (for example DATE) always refer to the receiving date of the message (for example R_DATE) when it arrived into the event log container, and are included only for compatibility reasons.

warning.para: If a remote host is logging into the event log of the local host that is running &agent;, both hosts have to be in the same timezone, because the event log message does not include the timezone information of the sender host. Otherwise, the date of the messages received from the remote host will be incorrect.

section.para: The following sections list the available macros:

warning.para: These macros are available only in the &agent;. To recognize Windows-specific elements of the log message (for example eventlog-related macros) on the syslog-ng server, you have to use parsers on the syslog-ng server. The parser must be configured to match the message format set in the syslog-ng Agent. For details on configuring parsers on your &abbrev; server, see .

para.link: Macros related to the date and time of the message

note.para: Note that if you use the Syslog protocol template (meaning that messages are sent using the IETF-syslog protocol), only the message part of the log message can be customized, the structure of the headers and other information is fixed by the protocol.

simplesect.title: HOST
simplesect.para: Description: Name of the host sending the message. Hostnames are automatically converted to lowercase.

simplesect.title: MESSAGE
simplesect.para: Description: The content of the message, including the text of the message and any file- or event-specific macros that are set for the source.

simplesect.title: MSG
simplesect.para: Description: An alias for the MESSAGE macro.

simplesect.title: PRI
simplesect.para: Description: Priority header of the message, storing the facility and the level of the message.

simplesect.title: ISODATE, R_ISODATE, S_ISODATE
simplesect.para: Description: Date of the message in the ISO 8601 compatible standard timestamp format (yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss+-ZONE), for example: 2006-06-13T15:58:00.123+01:00. If possible, it is recommended to use ISODATE for timestamping. Note that the &agentabbrev; cannot produce fractions of a second (for example milliseconds) in the timestamp.

simplesect.title: WEEKDAY, R_WEEKDAY, S_WEEKDAY
simplesect.para: Description: The 3-letter name of the day of week the message was sent, for example Thu.

simplesect.title: EVENT_CATEGORY
simplesect.para: Description: The category of the event.

simplesect.title: EVENT_DATA
simplesect.para: Description: Empty macro, does not contain any data.

simplesect.title: EVENT_CONTAINER_COUNTER
simplesect.para: Description: The number of received messages per container since the &agent; was started.

simplesect.title: EVENT_FACILITY
simplesect.para: Description: The facility that sent the message.

simplesect.title: EVENT_GLOBAL_COUNTER
simplesect.para: Description: A unique ID for messages generated at reception time on the receiving host. It facilitates defining relationships between messages that are potentially distributed to different files on the same host, or different hosts.

simplesect.title: EVENT_HOST
simplesect.para: Description: The name of the host that sent the log message.

simplesect.title: EVENT_ID
simplesect.para: Description: The identification number of the event.

simplesect.title: EVENT_LEVEL
simplesect.para: Description: Importance level of the message represented as a number: 6 - Success, 5 - Informational, 4- Warning, or 3 - Error).

simplesect.title: EVENT_MESSAGE
simplesect.para: Description: The content of the message.

simplesect.title: EVENT_MESSAGE_XML
simplesect.para: Description: Contains the entire message in XML format. Available only on Windows Vista, Server 2008, and newer platforms.

simplesect.title: EVENT_MSG
simplesect.para: Description: The content of the message. This is an alias of the EVENT_MESSAGE.

simplesect.title: EVENT_MSG_XML
simplesect.para: Description: Contains the entire message in XML format. This is an alias of the EVENT_MESSAGE_XML. Available only on Windows Vista, Server 2008, and newer platforms.

simplesect.title: EVENT_NAME
simplesect.para: Description: Name of the Windows event log container (for example Application or Security).

simplesect.title: EVENT_PROVIDER
simplesect.para: Description: Name of the service that generated the log message.

simplesect.title: EVENT_REC_NUM
simplesect.para: Description: The record number of the event in the event log.

simplesect.title: EVENT_SID
simplesect.para: Description: The security identification number of the event.

simplesect.title: EVENT_SID_TYPE
simplesect.para: Description: The security identification number resolved into name. One of the following: User, Group, Domain, Alias WellKnownGroup, DeletedAccount, Invalid, Unknown, Computer.

simplesect.title: EVENT_SOURCE
simplesect.para: Description: The application that created the message.

simplesect.title: EVENT_TASK
simplesect.para: Description: The task category of the event. Available only on Windows Vista, Server 2008, and newer platforms.

simplesect.title: EVENT_TYPE
simplesect.para: Description: The importance level of the message in text format.

simplesect.title: EVENT_USERNAME
simplesect.para: Description: The user running the application that created the message.

simplesect.title: FILE_CURRENT_POSITION
simplesect.para: Description: The position of the message from the beginning of the file in bytes.

simplesect.title: FILE_SIZE
simplesect.para: Description: The current size of the file in bytes.
